author: Tony Nuñez
comment: Almost there, but the overlay window on the phone indicating the playlist is being played doesn't go away. Also, when music is initiated thru this app and played via Bluetooth it interferes with signal and goes in and out. One Plus 2 Oxygen 2.2.1 Android 5.1.1
title: Potential

author: Ethan Hall
comment: The entire point of using your watch to start a playlist is so you don't have to pull out your phone. This app opens Spotify, and opens the playlist! So close! But then you have to manually hit play. Which defeats the entire purpose. Not worth anything it wants you to pay until it adds that one simple feature.
title: Not worth buying!

author: Viktor Vigoda
comment: Works fine. One problem is that it doesn't launch Spotify and start playing music when it isn't already running in the background and screen is locked. I always have to unlock the home screen and then it begins to play instantly. That kind of defeats the purpose, because you have to use your phone to play music... Is that something I can fix in the settings?

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi Viktor, we are working on that issue and hopefully next update should fix it.

author: Eric Lopez
comment: When using voice command from Android Wear, aways get an Error message saying "Playlist not found". When I select the playlist manually on Android Wear, a random playlist with a similar name from Google Music is played. So disappointed. I really wanted this to work.

author: Fredrik Ravlo
comment: So I haven't really gotten to test it. But looks good.. Please fix this, I would REALLY like for this to work :-)
title: Crashes whenever I try and open a Google Music playlists

author: Sam Peppou-Chapman
comment: After initially not working due to a quirk of some of my spotify playlists (which the dev worked with me to fix), the app seems to be able to start most of my playlists from my watch.

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi Sam, can you share more detail at dhaval@jumpbyte.com or submit the crash log so that we can analyse and fix the issue?

title: Works pretty well

author: Topher Dykes
comment: Run into some problems with this recently, when using via pebble. Unfortunately at the moment, selecting a playlist is causing Google play music to crash
title: Usually good

author: Patrick Chan
comment: It was good but since GPM changed how playlist works in search this app no longer works, and the dev probably moved on to another project.  Shame.
title: Didn't work anymore

author: Magnus Carlsson
comment: Just what I was looking for. Now I can easily select Spotify playlist from my pebble. Update: It no longer works to start up the Pebble app directly to the favourite list. It used to work before I paid for it...
title: Perfect, almost

author: Csongor Szíjjártó
comment: What this app does is only starting to play a playlist from the first track, nothing else. No play/pause, next track or volume buttons. And it even asks you to pay for this "feature" . Disappointed.

author: Danny Hull
comment: Gives an error message on Google play music. Then closes out.
title: Simply does not work

author: Scott Merritt
comment: Keeps pulling up random playlists from Google Play music (with the same playlist name as mine) instead of playlists from my account. For instance I have a playlist titles Guardians of the Galaxy and instead of the playlist it pulls up the Soundtrack to the movie which is not even in my library. For my playlist Battlecry it pulls up a completely different playlist of songs I have never even heard. I know it is connected to my account because the only playlist names listed are mine.

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi Scott, the issue is with the Google All Account which you can disable from the settings and then you should be able to see only local playlists. If you have any more issues please drop an email to dhaval@jumpbyte and I will help you resolve them.

comment: Paid for it and it just crashes in Google Play on my phone the moment I hit Play a playlist on my watch. You need to answer the dozens of people that have this same experience before collecting any more money.

author: Brandon Witte
comment: Defeats the purpose of the application when it can't play spotify playlists from pebble when the screen is locked.
title: Won't work when screen is locked

author: Stephen Coltharp
comment: Not sure why I paid $2 to "start" a playlist..
title: No Play/Pause/Song selection.

author: Michael Brancato
comment: Sure it changes the playlist, but it does not play the music.

author: Alex Stewart
comment: Can't play music from watch to Bluetooth headphones or speakers
title: Pointless

author: Ethan Munang
comment: I'm on a Nexus 6P with a regular Pebble and when I select a playlist it goes on the playlist if my phone is unlocked but when I press play on music it still plays music from the previously selected playlist.
title: Not working

author: Franziska Haaf
comment: So... I can open my playlists in Spotify but NOT start to play them per pebble? Is this a bug? This way I won't use or even buy the app.
title: No start of tracks?

author: Cris Moody
comment: Good interface. Like the favorites feature. Since it won't play there playlists when it pulls them up, not very useful.
title: Won't play

author: Mark Trudgian
comment: Paid for it but it didn't work

author: Franky T
comment: Just make sure you have the latest version of Spotify downloaded, great app!
title: works perfectly

comment: Why make the app free if you cant use it without purchasing it anyway??

author: Jacob Bohn
comment: Why the heck is Google play free and Spotify costs $2 to use

author: Godish Review
comment: Can select playlist but cannot play?! Wtf is this man!!!
title: Wtf?!

author: Mary Blueflower
comment: Doesn't work

author: Mischief City
comment: Unusable

author: Ryan Rueckert
comment: App was not working, but developer seems responsive, and pushed a fix quickly. Now it does what it advertises, which adds must have functionality to my Pebble Steel. Still experiencing some minor bugs, which I will be emailing the developer about.

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. Please email the issues at dhaval@jumpbyte.com and I will be happy to resolve them.

title: Minor issues, works great, expect it to improve.

author: Gintare Laboviciute
comment: Nowhere in the description does it say that you need to pay to unlock Spotify. Disappointed, thought it was a free app. Wouldn't mind paying if you were forewarned, otherwise it is just misleading.
title: Need to pay to unlock Spotify

author: Zach Sutton
comment: Got this app so I can use Spotify on my pebble...can't get app to work as of yet...

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi Zach, are you using the latest version of the Pebble app (v3.0) we pushed the version last week only along with an update of android app. If not can you switch to that and see whether it works. In case you have more issue please write me at dhaval@jumpbyte.com and I will help.

title: Dosen't Work

author: Walter CCH
comment: Add JOOX music app support plz

author: Marc Laforest
comment: To bad could be nice. I'm using Pebble with Android 4.4.2. App crash when starting a playlist.                          Update I install android 5.0.1 on my S4 and now the app work but load only 3 playlists. My phone have around 60 playlists.

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi, thanks for the feedback. Which part is not working for you? Are you using Wear or Pebble? Will really appreciate if you can send more detail to dhaval@jumpbyte.com, so that I can resolve your issue.

title: Not working! You have to pay to get it work

author: Jordan Smith
comment: Don't bother if you have All-Access, it won't work. Hopefully they can fix this at some point.

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi Jordan, please email me your purchase detail at dhaval@jumpbyte.com and I will refund your purchase. If you want to give it a try, please send the issue you are facing and I will be happy to resolve them. Unfortunately your review does not show which device you are using so we are not sure what could be the issue.

author: Joaquin Dayrit
comment: It worked great with my Spotify premium. I have been looking for a Pebble app that works with Spotify (and is free)  and I have found it. PS: keep it up
title: Amazing. And FREE

author: Edward Furey
comment: Awesome! I've looked for ages for something that can do this. Thank you, thank you, thank you!
title: Playlists on Pebble!

author: Jesse Coletta
comment: Only seeing my Google Play music that is downloaded, and local. I have very few playlists as I have little phone space. Is it intended to function like this? I hope not, as it would be useful. Also, when choosing a new playlist to start it starts the last song that was played, even if it was in a different playlist.

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi Jesse, the Google All Access has no third-party integration available, so we are not able make that work properly. So the app flags your remote playlists which you will not see on your watch, you will have to download them to make it work. If you can send me your issues me at dhaval@jumpbyte.com I will be happy to resolve them.

title: Stored in cloud?

author: Aron van de Pol
comment: After contact with the developer he definitely improved the app, there is still work to be done, but all in due time. Thanks for this amazing app!

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi Aron, thanks for the feedback. We are working on another update to make the app work better both feature and performance wise. If you can send us some detail at dhaval@jumpbyte.com it will be really helpful. We would really like to know what sort of issues you are facing on your phone and where the app needs improvements.

title: All in due time, works fine for now. Will become better, i have faith in that.

comment: Used to be able to see all my Play playlists on my watch from my Droid maxx phone but now I can't unless I download them? Um, no. And I have to pay to use the Spotify part of the app? No again. There is already a free Pebble Spotify app that does just fine. Guess I'll uninstall this. Kind of disappointing really.

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi Dubya, sorry to disappoint you. Some users complained about All Access playlists so we disabled them for now unless they are local. We are releasing an update which will show them just like they used to with Settings option so that you can enable or disable them. Spotify feature was paid from the beginning already.

title: Well, it WAS great.

author: Kenneth Pang
comment: If you're using Play Music without All Access, app works gloriously fine. Highly recommended.  Developer is friendly and responsive. Will leave app installed to see if any workaround is found for All Access.
title: Working great for Pebble with small caveat

author: Phil Stanbridge
comment: Why would you advertise all these features eg spotify and you can't even try them out until you pay for the app. This tells me you have no confidence in your app for people to try it before they buy. Deleted!!!

reply.author: JumpByte
reply.content: Hi Phil, you can try the app for Google Play Music which is free and there you can check how the app works from Wear/Pebble. We are charging for the Spotify integration. As of now we do not have Trial period option but, will update you if in future we have that option.

title: Rip off
